isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - ADJUSTMENTS - DOOR HALF OF HINGE (BEFORE DECEMBER 5, 1994)

svcproc.title: DOOR HALF OF HINGE (BEFORE DECEMBER 5, 1994)
svcproc.para: Adjust door forward or back at enlarged holes in door half of hinge through mounting bolt access holes in the door panel.

step1.para: Remove door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Remove.
Remove mounting bolt access hole plugs (Item 4, Figure 51) from door panel at upper and lower hinges.
Slightly loosen flanged head mounting bolts (Item 1, Figure 52), two each hinge, one hinge at a time.
Move door forward or back as required to obtain proper door position.
Once door adjustment is made, hold door in place. Then tighten the flanged head mounting bolts (Item 1, Figure 52), two each hinge. Tighten to 20 to 28 ft-lbs. (27 to 38 Nm).
Once the first hinge is adjusted, repeat this procedure to adjust the other hinge.

After both hinges have been adjusted, close door and check for proper fit. If further adjustment is required, repeat this procedure. If door adjustment is all right, re-install hinge mounting bolt access hole plugs (Item 4, Figure 51) in door panel at upper and lower hinges.
Install door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Install.
